subject: Re: "Warming up" a box?
author: ourobouros2k2
full_text:
I have usually received good results without any warmup period. I think 
that this is more the byproduct of being lucky and not the norm as many 
people report that a good warmup period is required. Although I have 
been lucky, I know that people often report that the boxes don't 
necessrily hit the ground running. 

thanks
Andy


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "wgungfu" <wgungfu3@...> wrote:
>
> Anyone have any process they follow for breaking in a new box? 
> Specific ways of opening communications, specific questions, lengths
> of sessions when first starting it out, etc.?  Might be good for
> people to share for everyone else here and fits in with the idea of
> the FAQ proposed earlier today.
> 
> I fired it up my goldBox for about 5 minutes just to try it out.  Kept
> it simple, and said speficially "Testing out new box, please assist. 
> Please say 'hello'".  Followed in the second half of the session with
> "Please say 'one'". 
> 
> 
> 
> Marty
>
